newsitem.title: USA: Mayflower move to add 500 jobs in St. Louis area.
newsitem.headline: Mayflower move to add 500 jobs in St. Louis area.

text.p: UniGroup Inc said Friday it will add at least 500 new jobs to its existing operations in the St. Louis area with the relocation of its Mayflower Transit corporate headquarters to Fenton, Mo. from Carmel, Ind.

"The cost and complexity of attempting to operate a $400 million company like Mayflower from St. Louis, 250 miles away, proved to be a major challenge," said Robert Baer, chief executive officer of Mayflower and president of UniGroup, which acquired Mayflower on March 30, 1995.
Baer said it could not estimate the number of Carmel, Ind. employees likely to make the move.
Mayflower is the nation's fourth-largest household goods moving company. UniGroup also is the parent company of United Van Lines, United Leasing Inc, Vanliner Group Inc and UniGroup Worldwide Inc.
